Contact information: Include full name, address, phone number and email address.
CV objective or personal statement: A personal statement in a CV is a brief summary that highlights skills, experiences, and career goals. It introduces the candidate to recruiters and showcases suitability for the job.
Academic history: List all schooling from high school through postdoctoral (if applicable). Include the title of the degree earned, the year of graduation, and the name of the school.
Work experience: Include the organization worked for, job title, dates of employment, and a summary of knowledge and achievements.
Qualifications and skills: List a combination of hard and soft skills developed throughout the career.
Awards and honors: For each award, include the name, year received, awarding organization, and pertinent details (such as how often it is presented).
Publications and presentations: For publications, provide a full citation including co-authors, date, summary, volume, page, and date of issue (DOI) number. For presentations, provide the title, date, and venue.
Professional associations: List the organizations name, location or chapter, and dates of active membership.
Grants and scholarships: Provide the name of the grant or scholarship, the date awarded, and the institution that provided the award.
Licenses and certifications: Include the name of the license or certificate, the date earned, and the institution that awarded it.
